page.title: 05Malt Mill Lane Resident
page.content: Until 1972 the Tudor and Victorian buildings in Malt Mill lane were derelict and in ruins. People moved out of them after the second world war. In 1972 they were restored and modernised and now form part of a sheltered housing scheme for the elderly.The area won an award for design. The people who live there come from all over the country but a few come from Alcester.All agreed the scheme was excellent with its resident wardens. "No one need be lonely", one old lady said but added "I miss my garden to hang out the washing".MRS Tanner,an Alcester resident for 67 years thought Alcester had changed for the worse ."All the little shops have gone and crime has increased.I much prefer life in the thirties.
